_header: That may ye see by a lady
Note: For other MSS which place the rubric eighteen lines earlier see 3438; for another version, see 6660.
_description: The Abbess who went with Child: Narratio in the Northern Homily Cycle

BodSelSup52.First Lines:
Of on ded I wyll for þischew yow of hys grett
                    mercy…
BodSelSup52.Last Lines:
…To þat blys þer Ioy ys ayGod graunt yt vs at our
                    last day

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
ÞAt may we seo by a ladiÞat was In a
                    Nonneri…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…In to þat court þer heo is QweneÞider heo
                    bringe vs alle bi dene. Amen.
BodEngPoeta1.Attributed Title:
Hou on abbesse wyt chylde was delyuered þorou vr lady (f.
                        178rb)
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.
BodEngPoeta1.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             “Die Evangelien-Geschichten der Homiliensammlung des Ms. Vernon.” 
             Archiv für das Studium der neueren Sprachen und
                Literaturen
         57 (1877): 241-316: 257.

CULAdd8335.First Lines:
It was an abbes of a nonneryÞat mekil honoured oure swete
                    lady…
CULAdd8335.Last Lines:
…To þat blisse þere sche is ayGod graunte vs
                    þat at oure ded day
CULAdd8335.Attributed Title:
Narracio de quodam abbatissam pregnante & liberata per sanctam
                        Mariam (p. 87)

CULDd11.First Lines:
And þat may ȝe se be a ladiÞat was abbes of a
                    Nunneri…
CULDd11.Last Lines:
…In to þat court þer sche is queneþedir sche
                    bringe vs alle be dene

CULGg531.First Lines:
Þat may ȝe se by a leuedyþat was abbas of a
                    NunryBot als scho went opon a dayabout þe nedes of hyr
                    abbay…
CULGg531.Last Lines:
vnto þat court þare scho es qweneþidere scho bryng vs
                    all by denne
CULGg531.Note:
Break between this and preceding 139 is two lines later in this MS, so 3290 begins,
                    ‘Bot als scho went opon a day…’

BLHar4196.First Lines: Als þis Abbes went on a dayObout þe nedis of hir Abbay…
BLHar4196.Last Lines: …Vnto þat court whare scho es queneþeder scho bring us al bidene

BLAdd38010.First Lines:
That may we se be a ladyThat was abbas of a
                    Nunnry…
BLAdd38010.Last Lines:
…That wyfes shuld on þe morn hir lokeffor þe bysshop
                    agaynes þe morne…
BLAdd38010.Note:
The item is incomplete: it appears that one folio is missing. There is a
                    catchword at the bottom of f. 48v indicating that the word at the
                    beginning of the next folio should be ‘somonde’. However, the next
                    folio instead goes straight into the next homily (3106-6).

EDCPCM.First Lines:
Þat may ye se bi a lefdyÞat was abbes of a
                    nunrye…
EDCPCM.Last Lines:
…Þat þai haued chesoun hir againAnd wit þair
                    letteres prayed þaye…
EDCPCM.Note:
This MS marks the begining of 3290 two lines later, beginning,
                    ‘Bot als scho…’ (i.e. treats first two lines of this as last
                    two of 169); ends imperfectly:
                    last 87 lines missing due to loss of folio(s).
EDCPCM.Editions:
Small,  John,
                        ed.  
             English Metrical Homilies….
         Edinburgh: W. Paterson, 1862: 164-67 (with lines 88-172 from Cambridge UK,  Cambridge University Library Gg.5.31).
Thompson,  Anne B.,
                        ed.  
             The Northern Homily
                    Cycle.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008.

MinULZ822.First Lines:
þat may ȝe se be a lauedyþat was abbas of a
                    Nunery…
MinULZ822.Last Lines:
…Vnto þat curte þare sche es queneThider scho bryng
                    vs all be dene

HunHM129.First Lines:
Þat may we se by a leuedyÞat abbas wos off a
                    nunry…
HunHM129.Last Lines:
…In to þat court whar scho is queneþeddyr scho bryng
                    vs all be dene

Corbett,  Maryann.
